title: What is the coolest technology that you wish existed today and that you think will exist in the future? - Quora

response.answer_text: The food replicator.  In Star Trek a replicator is a machine capable of creating (and recycling) objects. Replicators were originally seen used to synthesize meals on demand, but in later series they took on many other uses.[1] Craving for something on Tastemade? No problem! You just copy and paste it on your replicator. Bam! You have it! That’s food on-demand at its finest. Will it exist in the future? Of course! Molecular 3D printing is already happening.  A group of chemists led by medical doctor Martin D. Burke at the University of Illinois created a machine which could be described as a major breakthrough in the field of chemistry, a ‘molecule-making machine’ or the 3D printer for chemicals[2]. Soon we’ll be printing our own food from scratch.  Footnotes[1] Replicator (Star Trek) - Wikipedia[2] Breakthrough Molecular 3D Printer Can Print Billions of Possible Compounds

I'd like AI computers that you can tell them what you want and they do it. Not just simple commands but complex reasoning and intelligent actions that are beyond their programming. I'd like a human brain to computer interface that allows us to: Download stuff to our brainsCommand things with our brainsAllow people with debilitating illnesses​ to communicate
I think teleportation or time travel will be invented in the future
